column4: hello..i am facing problem with running linux kernel 2.6 in virtual machine. i have compiled and created iso image of kernel but when i boot the machine it says boot failed
i suspect i have not configured bootloading part
can anyone help..do i have to configure boot loader or something?
you cant boot a kernel as iso :)
You could start with the link I gave you.

All you have to to is to copy it to your /boot in your VM, create a grub entry, and to install the modules. You really should go about creating .debs for y new kernel instead of installing it that way.
i am relatively new to linux. How can i create a grub entry in vm?
You should read that document and do it that way, not the manual way you are approaching.
And for booting a kernel with an ISO, you need qemu, not vbox.
but a lot of places i have seen vbox using iso to boot
Right, and ISO that boot an OS, and not just a single kernel.
